Add statements to identify the "Kept Local" status and make "PRE<VERSION>"copies of the "renamed" records.
Delete set.unknow.action panel and change the exit set.bad.result

Added processing to make sure the value for the active flag in language records is retained when upgrading these records. Added new process panel 'fix.language', called from decision panel 'add.check.exceptions'. The original value of the active flag is saved on panel 'start.del.process'.
QC62639 [Upgrade] Cleanup/revise log messaging and formatting in upgrade.log
remove the panels: check.log.begin and log.data
Added code to panels setup.init.old and exit.normal to temporarily turn off the counter for MySM tables to prevent duplicate key errors from occuring during the renaming process.
Reverted last change on panel=check.get.make..... changed decision statement from
null($L.field.type)
back to.....
null($L.make)
modified to prepare paremeters for the app make.sig function.
Modified versioning on start panel to support 9.30
On panel=setup.init.old, changed:
if ($L.wrkIdx>1
to...
if ($L.wrkIdx>=1
Without this change, the 1st language in the language array was always being processed, regardless if the user had selected it or not.
Added global ($G.sig.debug) to make.sig panel to assist in the debugging of missing or incorrect signatures.
DE3347 - Removing references to upgrade versions before SC6.2:
** start panel. Removed the followoing lines 34 - 36
$L.rem=" If upgrading from a version PRIOR to SC6.1, then change the 'problem management' number record "
$L.rem=" so that it becomes the 'incident management' number record. "

if ($G.tmpUpgFrmVerSeq<$G.tmpSC61VerSeq) then ($L.scsFlg=rtecall("rinit", $L.rtnCod, $L.numberBfr, "number");$L.numberQryVar="name=\""+"problem management"+"\"";$L.scsFlg=rtecall("select", $L.rtnCod, $L.numberBfr, $L.numberQryVar);if ($L.scsFlg=true and $L.rtnCod~=3) then (name in $L.numberBfr="incident management";$L.scsFlg=rtecall("rupdate", $L.rtnCod, $L.numberBfr)))
Adds support for previously reconciled records
Dont delete upgradeobjects that have been renamed
Stores the prefix in the upgraderesults table.
Saving the upgradeobjects key in the upgraderesult when the result is anything that will need to be resolved.
Modification made for DevTx Ticket I2529.This problem is really a follow-up to DevTx ticket I2326.

Back in that ticket (I2326), a statement was added (in panel set.add) to delete the records that make up an application cluster prior to adding the new application. What was overlooked in that fix was that there could be multiple records in the application file. That fix was only deleting the first application record that matched the application name.
In this fix (for I2529), that statement was modified so that ALL the application records in the application files are deleted, not just the first application record.
Modification made for DevTx ticket I2596.
Before updating the number file, the "problem management" record is changed so that it is "incident management".
Modification made for DevTx ticket I2326.
An "Application Cluster" consists of records from the following files:
. enclapplrev
. enclapplication
. application
. format
. code

The upgrade looks at the code file to see if an application exists or not. There were cases where the code record did NOT exist, BUT the corresponding record DID exist in one or more of the other files comprising the application cluster. In these instances, this application was trying to add the record, which resulted in a Duplicate key error. This was fixed by modifying the code such that when trying to add an "Application Cluster", if any record exists in the files comprising the cluster, they are deleted first.
Modification for CenterPoint Request 32254 Task 29705.
Modification made to upgrade ONLY the languages selected by the customer in the following files:
. format . scmessage . help
To effect this change, the following panels were modified:
start

. Modified to put the information in the lang.selected array of strcutures into separate work arrays ($L.mltLanSelArr, $L.mltLanLanArr, $L.mltLanLanCodArr). Also, English is appended to these work arrays. It is these arrays that will be consulted to determine if a language has been selected for processing.
setup.init.old

. Modified to set the $L.prcLan flag to true or false. This is done by isolating the language code and looking up that language code in the $L.mltLanSelArr to see if it had been selected for processing. For the format and help records, the language code is the last two characters of the object.name field in the upgradeobjects file. For the scmessage file, the language code is embedded as the 12th and 13th characters of the object.name field in the upgradeobjects file.
. Normal Exit has been changed as follows:
Before modification: init.old
After modificatoin: check.multi.language
check.multi.language
New panel.
Modification made for SCR 31155 Task 28906.

Duplicate records were being written to the upgraderesults file during the upgrade. The cause of this problem is a change made to the RTE late in SC5.1. Prior to this RTE change, when you reference a field that is contained in an array of structure by its field name, the RTE was returning the value of the field in the FIRST occurrence of that structure. After this RTE change, instead of ONLY returning the value of the field in the FIRST occurrence of that structure, it was returning an array which contained the values of the field in each occurrence of that structure. This is no good because prior to this, a scalar field (the field in the first occurrence of the array) was being returned. Now, an ARRAY is being returned.
This (ie, an array instead of a scalar being returned) was somehow causing the RTE to write duplicate records into the upgraderesults file during the upgrade.

To remedy this problem, this application (apm.upgrade.data) was changed so that the field in question (ie, the name field in the upgradeobjects file, which is a field in an array of structures) is now referenced as 1 in 1 in 2 in $L.object INSTEAD of name in $L.object.
The following panels were changed as follows:
add.set.result, second line:
Value of line before this change: object.name in $L.result=name in $L.object
Value of line after this change: object.name in $L.result=1 in 1 in 2 in $L.object
set.bad.result, second line:
Value of line before this change: object.name in $L.result=name in $L.object
Value of line after this change: object.name in $L.result=1 in 1 in 2 in $L.object
set.current, second line:
Value of line before this change: object.name in $L.result=name in $L.object
Value of line after this change: object.name in $L.result=1 in 1 in 2 in $L.object
set.unknown.action, second line:
Value of line before this change: object.name in $L.result=name in $L.object
Value of line after this change: object.name in $L.result=1 in 1 in 2 in $L.object
For further details, please see the Technical Notes in CenterPoint Task 28906 for Request 31155.
Change made for DEVTX BUG14819.
When an object was "Forced", this application was hard-coding the prefix to be "OLDSC5". Change was made so that the prefix is "OLDvvv" where vvv is the version that the customer is upgrading from.
This was effected by changing the Prefix (names,1) value in the rnmold.bld.name as follows:
Before this change: str("OLDSC5")
After this change: str("OLD"+$G.tmpUpgFrmVer)
Per verbal instructions from PBudic:
Changed the 6th line in panel add.set.result as follows:
Before: if ($L.action="rename" and nullsub($L.unconditional, false)) then (result in $L.result="Upgraded/Forced")
After: if ($L.action="rename" and nullsub($L.unconditional, false)) then (result in $L.result="Forced")

What this does is that if the user chooses the option to "Replace your version of the object with Peregrine's version of the object", on the conflict resolution reports, any object that was renamed to OLDSC5xxxx will be flagged as "Forced" instead of "Upgraded/Forced".
Follow-up on 10/31/02 15:25:23 modification by esoriano:
See the MSWord document named CenterPointTask22052Rqs22943.doc attached to CenterPoint Task 22052 for Request 22943 for details of what was done to correct the problem.
Made change to enable the upgrade option "Replace your version of the object with Peregrine's version of the object."
